This set the foundation for a multi-year initiative to not only build a new common experience for their key manufacturing stakeholders, but also to set an important platform in which the benefits of data and AI can be realized under the umbrella of 'Smart Manufacturing' or 'Industry 4.0'

Lead the architecture for the cloud based integration layer which integrated IoT devices from equipment deployed globally, an SAP instance hosted on a private cloud, and exposed API’s through a microservices architecture to a customer portal.  Lead the RFI and proof-of-concept for an edge device to integrate with client equipment and communicate data securely over cellular and satellite networks.

projects.name: Cognitive Traffic Monitoring
projects.outcome: Visibility into Traffic through IoT
projects.summary: Designed and Lead an End-To-End Solution to monitor traffic on a busy industrial construction site
projects.description: For a downstream chemical company in the Oil and Gas industry, provided a cloud based solution to monitor the flow of traffic on a busy construction site.  The solution used a combination of GPS tracking devices for shuttle buses, cameras with visual recognition to detect traffic congestion, and smart cones to help automate road closures.  The solution integrated to the client’s enterprise portal and also offered the ability for construction workers to ask questions through their “push-to-talk” device to receive information on current traffic conditions.

projects.name: Offshore Drilling Performance Monitoring
projects.outcome: Measuring and Improving the Drilling Process with AI and IoT
projects.summary: Designed and Lead an End-To-End Solution to Monitor Drilling Performance on Offshore Oil Rigs
projects.description: For an offshore drilling provider in the Oil and Gas industry, provided a hybrid cloud based solution to monitor the drilling performance of 14 drilling rigs.  The solution uses IoT and Edge computing to collect data in real-time using a variety of protocols on the rig (OPC, WitsML) and send the data in real-time to a cloud environment to identify “operational events” such as running riser, pulling riser, and casing.  The technology in the cloud environment used predictive analytics to identify the operational events from a combination of sensor data from the drilling equipment and operator logs.  The operational events were then rendered as KPI’s using an HTML 5 dashboard and business analytics for “slice and dice” and “drill-down”.  While providing the architecture and overall staffing model for the solution, I also provided day-to-day guidance for the development team as well as hands-on development the IoT edge components running on the rigs.

projects.name: End To End IoT Mobile Demo
projects.outcome: Demonstrate IoT with IBM Watson
projects.summary: Designed an End-To-End IoT Demo with a Mobile Interface enabled by Watson
projects.description: In an effort to learn the IBM Watson IoT and Cloud stack in great depth, I built an “end-to-end” demo to understand what it takes to pull together a solution.  The demo used a Raspberry PI running python with a motion sensor and a camera, which communicates with Watson IoT with MQTT  to detect movement and take pictures on-demand.  The demo also used “Node Red” on the back-end to post-process the data in various ways, such as runnign Visual Recongition on the camera images to detect the presence of a human being in the office.  The demo also used a custom iOS mobile application to provide a conversation interface using IBM’s Watson to have a conversation, allowing simple questions sich as “Is there anyone in my office”, or “When was the last time someone was in my office”, or a command such as “Take a snapshot in my office”.  The iOS mobile application was written in Apple’s Swift programming language, used REST / JSON based services from the back-end cloud environment, and also took advantage of push notifications to be notified when there was movement in my office and I was not present.

In addition ot the videos, there were 10 key samples illustrating how to build Java based services that could run both on the edge and the cloud.  The approach for the videos was to explain key concepts, and then back that up with steps and overview of the samples.  PLAT.ONE was acquired by SAP in 2016 and the videos were leveraged by SAP to help understand the capabilities of the platorm and integrate into SAP’s Leonard Stack.

projects.name: Supply Chain Command Center
projects.outcome: Respond to situations in the supply chain that will disrupt customer service
projects.summary: Lead the development of a monitoring system for a command center to monitor break-fix and repair services
projects.description: Lead the overall effort to design a next generation command center, which watches over the entire field service dispatch process to ensure customer satisfaction and that they are meeting SLA for their different customer sets.  This was an end-to-end delivery to replace their existing system they had built over a period of 5 years in about 6 months, using off the shelf BPM, BEP, BRMS, and BI software from Progress Software.  RPM is Progress's term for the next generation of BPM, combining business process, analytics, rules, and complex event processing into a platform to build highly responsive business applications. A key aspect of the delivery was the use of a custom methodology that I created in support of such an implementation.  This implementation also used Service Oriented (SOA) concepts to enable end-users access to enterprise systems from a common portal.

projects.name: Process Visiblity
projects.outcome: Drive a plan to derive value out of enhanced visiblity into spanning business process
projects.summary: Lead several workshops across a variety of industries to create benefits from enhanced process visiblity and create an actionable plan for implementation
projects.description: Using the RPM Deployment Methodology, lead several collaborative workshops with our early adopter customers to conceive the RPM solution.  Customers spanned across many industries, including pharmaceuticals, logistics, financial services, and high tech manufacturing.  The design of the workshop was to take a high level concept or vision, and translate it into 'actionable', 60-90 day deliverables to help the customer realize the value of the solution.  The technical nature of the solution included BPM ('Business Process Management') for human process work-flow, analytics for real-time visualization, BEP/CEP ('Business Event Procesing, Complex Event Processing') for real-time event correlation, and BTM  ('Business Transaction Management') for event extraction from enterprise systems such as SAP, databases, J2EE, and .NET environments.  The end solution also included a front-end portal built on industry standard java, allowing multiple users the ability to gain insight into the operational activities within their environment.

projects.name: Automated Telecom Testing Platform
projects.outcome: Automated testing of 100's of test to create a high quality system
projects.summary: Invented and created an automated test platform using voice recognition and automation to verify the function of a calling card platfom
projects.description: Delivered an automated test platform for a long distance company’s calling card platform.  Responsibilities included gathering requirements from the customer, designing the system, managing the development (2 contractors), deployment of the platform, and training end users.  The test platform consisted of a user interface to run test calls, as well as a development environment to create test scripts.  The test scripts were developed using a set of API’s which provide voice recognition to validate prompts and simulate a user pressing keys on the telephone keypad.  The system also validated the data in the calling card database which resided on an IBM mainframe running MVS.  The system was implemented using DirectTalk/6000, the HARK BBN Voice Recognition engine, and custom software written in C under AIX.

projects.name: Matrixed Switch Controller

projects.description: Member of a small team tasked with designing and developing a matrix switch controller to be integrated as part of a long distance communication company’s services platform.  The matrix switch controller enhanced the platform by providing advanced switching services, such as conferencing, audio on hold, and multiple outdials.  The software was implemented on an RS/6000 under AIX using C and C++.  It communicated via TCP/IP to a Summa Four switch, and UDP/IP to the enhanced services platform.  The Summa Four connected to the public telephone network using ISDN Primary Rate with NFAS groups.  Designed and developed the statistics and call trace record portion of the switch controller.  Member of the integration team which tested the software at the customer site.

The application was written in C using IBM's Database Manager and NetBIOS application programming interfaces.
